title: Airlie, Oregon
text:
Airlie is an <a href="Unincorporated%20area">unincorporated community</a> in <a href="Polk%20County%2C%20Oregon">Polk County</a>, <a href="Oregon">Oregon</a>, United States.
The community was named for <a href="David%20Ogilvy%2C%2010th%20Earl%20of%20Airlie">David Ogilvy</a>, 10th <a href="Earl%20of%20Airlie">Earl of Airlie</a> of Scotland, who was president of the narrow-gauge <a href="Oregonian%20Railway%20Company">Oregonian Railway Company</a>. Airlie was the southern terminus of the railroad. The tracks were later widened to standard gauge and the line was bought by the <a href="Southern%20Pacific%20Transportation%20Company">Southern Pacific Railroad</a>, which removed the Airlie branch by 1929. Airlie post office was established in 1882 and ran intermittently until 1943.
The Airlie Red Flesh.
A <a href="List%20of%20apple%20cultivars">cultivar</a> of domesticated <a href="apple">apple</a>, the <a href="Airlie%20Red%20Flesh">Airlie Red Flesh</a>, originated in Airlie.
